title: Help. Searching for this font
content:
I'm enamored by this font. It looks like a Chancery like font with Flourish Caps but I haven't been able to find it anywhere.  
Anyone have a clue where this is from and the name of it?

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [0001\_Richter\_perky\_wedding\_invite-600x450.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20110323105312/http:/typophile.com/files/0001_Richter_perky_wedding_invite-600x450.jpg) | 87.43 KB |
| [0003\_Richter\_perky\_save\_the\_date-600x450.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20110323105312/http:/typophile.com/files/0003_Richter_perky_save_the_date-600x450.jpg) | 106.38 KB |
author: bbluegardenia

comments.content:
It sure looks like a font was used, but I can't say it looks like anything I can recall. The leaf-shaped swash terminals should be good earmarks. It could be a custom font designed for the stationer (in order to prevent desktop customer end-runs to save money).

- Mike Yanega
The only thing I can recognize here is the ampersand which is from Balmoral but other than that.. I'm still searching..

Looks like a combination of [Adobe Caslon Italic Swash](http://web.archive.org/web/20110323105312/http:/www.fonts.com/findfonts/detail.asp?pid=202079) with Adobe Caslon Italic Small Caps and some custom work added in for good measure.
